comments:
Build ID: I20070323-1616

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Find an update site behind a proxy server.  In my case all my internet access is through a proxy server.
2. Get updates from the remote site

I get an NPE.  

The problem is resolved once my proxy settings are correctly configured.  So the only issue here is really a disturbing error message when the proxy server is not set up.  A more user friendly message would be "Unable to access the remote site.  Please check your network settings in the preferences panel" or something like that.


More information:
eclipse.buildId=I20070323-1616
java.version=1.6.0_01
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -startup C:\eclipse\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.v20070319.jar -showConsole
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -startup C:\eclipse\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.equinox.launcher_1.0.0.v20070319.jar -showConsole -consoleLog

Error
Thu Apr 12 09:51:32 PDT 2007
An internal error occurred during: "Update Manager".

java.lang.NullPointerException
at java.io.FilterInputStream.close(FilterInputStream.java:155)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.connection.HttpResponse$MonitoringInputStream.close(HttpResponse.java:53)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.SiteURLFactory.createSite(SiteURLFactory.java:97)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.InternalSiteManager.createSite(InternalSiteManager.java:334)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.InternalSiteManager.createSite(InternalSiteManager.java:326)

at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.InternalSiteManager.attemptCreateSite(InternalSiteManager.java:222)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.InternalSiteManager.getSite(InternalSiteManager.java:162)
at org.eclipse.update.core.SiteManager.getSite(SiteManager.java:78)
at org.eclipse.update.search.UpdateSearchRequest.searchOneSite(UpdateSearchRequest.java:452)
at org.eclipse.update.search.UpdateSearchRequest.performSearch(UpdateSearchRequest.java:323)
at org.eclipse.update.ui.UpdateJob.runSearchForNew(UpdateJob.java:182)
at org.eclipse.update.ui.UpdateJob.run(UpdateJob.java:170)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
Please us M6+ build - I think this has been fixed.

I still got the error in 3.3M7 with Sun JDK 1.6.0_01. The trick is that I didn't have my proxy configured when I got the error, but when I configured it correctly the error went away. Actually I got two errors, one dialog that said their were no features on the site, and a dialog behind that that said an NPE had occurred.

To duplicate try to follow the instructions here behind a firewall with no proxy set up (direct connect to the internet):

https://openjfx.dev.java.net/javafx-eclipse-plugin-install.html

I did it about 5 times in a row this morning so it's reproducible. I didn't figure it out until I tried it under Eclipse 3.2 which gave me a better error message (one that mentioned the word proxy, which clued me in).

I am getting a similar exception using 3.3rc1 winxp. I don't think I have a proxy server set up, but I may be wrong. Anyway, here is the full exception stack trace

Using 3.4RC1 I can't recreate the problem.
This problem no longer occurs in 3.3.0.  I submitted the problem so I figure I'll resolve it as fixed.  Hope that's cool.
Yes, I remember fixing a number of NPEs related to this class.
